Text:
No matter how many times I visit, this place is
always bustling! It's full of tourist attractions.

The town symbol is the clock tower, I bet. It's almost
noon—when the clock strikes, the gears will move...

You certainly seem to be acting like we're on
vacation. This is official business, you know?

Y-You're right, forgive me. I got swept up in the
excitement.

Wait, this isn't a family vacation? Then why bring
us along?
He seems to think this counts as family bonding time.

You don't have to be so harsh... I might go bald from
the anxiety.

(I want to say that he probably doesn't have any
hair left to lose, but I hold my tongue.)

(But I guess this place must be safe if the baron can
bring his family along on an inspection.)
(There's some shady guy looking this way.)

(Whoever it is probably thinks his cover isn't
blown and nobody else has noticed anything...)

(The guy practically has "ill intent" written on his
face. He definitely has it in for somebody.)
(Now, how should I handle this chump...)

(I don't know who their target is, but I can't let
them escape.)

(It's not about justice, or helping people. It's for
my own sake. If my family dies, I'd just be
another sob story protagonist.)

(I'm a side character! At least that's what I want to
be perceived as. Better hurry up and deal with this.)
Why did you stop? Something on your mind?
Nope, nothing at all. Just admiring the scenery.

I try to keep the conversation going while thinking
about how to deal with the assassin. I can't use my
full strength in this situation.

I'm a pampered rich kid, that's my role. I need to
move soothly.
Which means...this.

I put my hand in my pocket and flick my fingers.
I can defeat the assasin with something small and
sharp... With all the bustle, nobody should notice.

But what should I use? What kind of projectile do I
have on me... Hm, this button will do the trick.

It's like how in some games there's a cool coin-
tossing skill...

Everyone reacts to the sound of coins falling...
I would. I'll go with the button, it's quieter.

(Just need to time it right. Father said the clock
tower strikes at noon...)
(If I can just aim for that exact moment—)
Now!
Tch...!
My, what a fine bell!
Indeed, it's a wonderful sound.

With everyone's attention on the clock tower, nobody
notices the assassin collapse to the ground.
(Now's our chance... Alpha!)

I glance at the alleyway where Alpha has been
standing by and she materializes in an instant,
grabbing and dragging the assassin's corpse
back with her.
Phew, that should be—
Um, Cid?
Ack!?

The button on your sleeve is missing. Did you catch
it on something?

(She hadn't been completely distracted by the clock
tower. Impressive...)

U-Um, yeah, maybe? I feel like it was there just a
second ago...

*sigh* You really are something. Let's buy a new
button and I'll sew it on for you later.

U-Um, no, it's fine. It was probably just a spare,
you know?

Actually, they say that button is there to make
rolling up your sleeves easier, or to prevent
soldiers from wiping their nose on them in
winter.

I don't know how it is in this world, but I don't
care enough to research it.

As the child of a noble family, you need to look
presentable. Let's go to the notions store.

Since we came all the way here, let's find you
something unique to this region.
O-Okay... Thank you.

There's no stopping her once she makes up her mind,
so I obediently follow her while she shops.

(I thought using a button was a good move, but who
knew that my sister had such eagle-eyes.)

(I guess I need to prepare a slime to use for
next time.)

(I can harden it with magic, and if it melts over
time... Perfect for crime. Not like I'll use it for
that, though.)

Cid, about the assassin from this afternoon... They
were connected with the Cult of Diablos.
Huh? Seriously?

Yes. There was a seal carved into their body...
But, before I could find out more, they took
their own life.

Hmm. I guess they're a top-class assassin
or something, huh.

(They didn't do a good job of staying undetected,
but regardless... A connection to the Cult, huh.)

(Since I was able to use Alpha as front for my
scenario, maybe it meant the assassin's target
was unrelated to the Kagenou family.)

(Or maybe they didn't have a specific target? Were
they in training? The way they blew their cover
seems to support that.)

(Well, they just picked the wrong target. They were
aware of what could happen the moment they let
their intentions be known.)
Thanks for your report. Let's keep our guard up.
Yes, for Master Shadow and the Shadow Garden.

(That being said, until I get bigger and strong enough
to bend magic to my will, I'm still in training too.)

(I...the shadowbroker...will continue to quietly
bide my time.)
